column11:
This table shows the Spring 2021 Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, separated by school. It includes undergraduate and graduate credit hours, graduate “extra credit” adjustments, and standardized FTE enrollments.

By School (Spring 2021):

Liberal Arts & Social Sciences – largest unit, with 45,889 credit hours, equal to about 2,929 FTEs.

Business – produced 14,162 credit hours, supporting 832 FTEs.

Education – contributed 5,528 credit hours, translating into 151 FTEs.

Health & Rehabilitation Sciences – generated 9,231 credit hours, equal to 445 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology – produced 33,000 credit hours, supporting 2,015 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – credits taught at each level.

Graduate Extra Credit – extra weighting for graduate instruction.

Grand Total Credit Hours – combined hours after adjustments.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – standardized enrollment equivalents (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).
